content: I do not have personal preferences. however, a notable example of a modern building that incorporates classical elements is the u.s. supreme court building in washington d.c. designed by architect cass gilbert and completed in 1935, the building's architecture incorporates elements of classical greek and roman architecture. the main façade features a massive portico with 16 columns, modeled after the temple of artemis in greece. the interior of the building also features classical design elements, such as marble columns, carved relief sculptures, and a grand staircase. the building is a testament to the enduring influence of classical architecture on modern design.
